column3: b'THE NEW YORK TIMES CONTRIBUTORS'

column9: b'(I\'m Nicholas Kristof.) As a journalist, I visited 140 nations & every one of this country\'s more than 30 provinces, even Hainan'

column21: b'(I\'m Gail Collins.) I was the New York Times\' first female editorial page editor & wrote a book called "America\'s Women", which begins with "The Extremely Brief Story of" the first English child born in the Americas'

column25: b'This Irish author of long, often confusing novels sent a short, clear wire in 1905: "Son born Jim"'
column27: b'(I\'m Roger Cohen.) In the 1990s, based in Zagreb, I was the New York Times\' chief of the bureau named for this peninsular region; I\'ve written many books & columns about conflict there'

column30: b'This farewell word first appeared in an English text in Hemingway\'s "A Farewell to Arms"'
column31: b'(Sarah of the Clue Crew reports from the National Archives in Washington, D.C.) Once deciphered, the Zimmerman telegram aided U.S. entry into World War I by enraging the public; Germany promised U.S. land to this country'

column33: b'(I\'m New York Times columnist Maureen Dowd.) The title of my book "Are Men Necessary?", exploring the implications of feminism, puts a twist on "Is Sex Necessary?", by E.B. White & this humorist'
